name: Camunda 8 (SaaS/Self-Managed)
description: Our primary engine for high-throughput process orchestration. Essential for state management in complex AI agent handoffs.

name: Embedded Camunda 7 Engines
description: Phasing out in favor of Camunda 8. No new projects should use embedded Spring Boot C7 architectures.

name: Kubernetes
description: Kubernetes is the de facto standard for container orchestration, enabling automated deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

name: Docker
description: Docker is a platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers, providing consistency across multiple development and release cycles.

name: Istio
description: An open-source service mesh that provides a way to control how microservices share data with one another.

name: Kafka
description: A distributed event streaming platform capable of handling trillions of events a day.

name: Node.js
description: Node.js is a lightweight web container that is a strong option for development of micro services and as a server to mobile and single-page web applications.

name: Plane project management tool
description: A modern project management tool designed for software development teams, focusing on simplicity and efficiency.

name: Spring Boot
description: Spring Boot allows easy setup of standalone Spring-based applications. It's ideal for pulling up new microservices and easy to deploy.

name: Next.js
description: Next.js is an opinionated, zero-configuration framework that includes simplified routing, automatic compilation and bundling.

name: Python3
description: Python 3 introduced many useful features that are not backward compatible with Python 2.x.

name: FastAPI
description: FastAPI is a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.7+ based on standard Python type hints.

name: React
description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, maintained by Facebook and a community of developers.

name: TypeScript
description: A superset of JavaScript that adds static typing, developed and maintained by Microsoft.

name: Django
description: A high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

name: Flask
description: A lightweight WSGI web application framework in Python, known for its simplicity and flexibility.

name: SDKMAN
description:
A tool for managing parallel versions of multiple Software Development Kits on most Unix-based systems.

name: Redis
description: An in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache, and message broker, known for its high performance and versatility.

name: Terraform
description: An open-source infrastructure as code software tool that provides a consistent CLI workflow to manage hundreds of cloud services.

name: Prometheus
description: An open-source systems monitoring and alerting toolkit originally built at SoundCloud, known for its powerful querying language and time-series data model.

name: Grafana
description: An open-source platform for monitoring and observability, allowing users to query, visualize, alert on, and understand their metrics no matter where they are stored.

name: GitHub Actions
description: A CI/CD platform that allows you to automate your build, test, and deployment pipeline right from GitHub.

name: Jenkins
description: An open-source automation server that enables developers to build, test, and deploy their software.

name: Grafana Loki
description: A log aggregation system designed to store and query logs from all your applications and infrastructure.

name: Helm
description: A package manager for Kubernetes that helps you manage Kubernetes applications.

name: OpenTelemetry
description: An open-source observability framework for cloud-native software, providing APIs and SDKs for generating, collecting, and exporting telemetry data.

name: Jaeger
description: An open-source, end-to-end distributed tracing tool used for monitoring and troubleshooting microservices-based distributed systems.

name: CircleCI
description: A continuous integration and continuous delivery platform that automates development workflows.

name: Selenium
description: An open-source tool for automating web browsers, primarily used for testing web applications.

name: Cypress
description: A front-end testing tool built for the modern web, enabling developers to write and run tests for web applications.

name: Cucumber
description: A tool for running automated tests written in plain language, promoting collaboration between technical and non-technical team members.

name: VsCode
description: A lightweight but powerful source code editor which runs on your desktop and is available for Windows, macOS and Linux.

name: IntelliJ IDEA
description: A powerful IDE for JVM languages like Java, Kotlin, Groovy, and Scala, known for its intelligent code completion and developer productivity features.

name: MsTeam
description: A collaboration platform that combines workplace chat, meetings, notes, and attachments.

name: Slack
description: A messaging app for teams that brings all communication together, creating a single unified archive accessible through powerful search.

name: iTerm2
description: A terminal emulator for macOS that offers features like split panes, hotkeys, and extensive customization options.

name: Pre-commit hooks
description: A framework for managing and maintaining multi-language pre-commit hooks, ensuring code quality before commits are made.

name: GitOps
description: A set of practices that use Git repositories as the source of truth for declarative infrastructure and applications.

name: Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
description: The practice of managing and provisioning computing infrastructure through machine-readable definition files, rather than physical hardware configuration or interactive configuration tools.

name: Microservices Architecture
description: An architectural style that structures an application as a collection of loosely coupled services, which implement business capabilities.

name: CI/CD Pipelines
description: A set of practices that enable development teams to deliver code changes more frequently and reliably through automated testing and deployment processes.

name: Test-Driven Development (TDD)
description: A software development approach where tests are written before the code, ensuring that the code meets the specified requirements.

name: Behavior-Driven Development (BDD)
description: An extension of TDD that encourages collaboration between developers, QA, and non-technical stakeholders through shared examples and scenarios.

name: Agile Methodologies
description: A set of principles for software development that emphasizes iterative development, collaboration, and flexibility to change.

name: Scrum
description: An agile framework for managing complex projects, focusing on iterative progress, collaboration, and adaptability.

name: Git Signed Commits
description: A method of signing Git commits and tags to verify the authenticity and integrity of the code changes.

name: BPMN for Process Modeling
description: A graphical representation for specifying business processes in a business process model, widely used for process automation and improvement.

name: Event-Driven Architecture
description: A software architecture pattern that promotes the production, detection, consumption, and reaction to events, enabling real-time processing and responsiveness.

name: Serverless Architecture
description: A cloud computing execution model where the cloud provider dynamically manages the allocation and provisioning of servers, allowing developers to focus on code without managing infrastructure.

name: Zero Trust Security Model
description: A security concept that assumes no implicit trust is granted to assets or user accounts based solely on their physical or network location.

name: DevSecOps
description: An approach that integrates security practices within the DevOps process, ensuring that security is a shared responsibility throughout the software development lifecycle.

name: Chaos Engineering
description: The discipline of experimenting on a system to build confidence in its capability to withstand turbulent conditions in production.

name: Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
description: A discipline that incorporates aspects of software engineering and applies them to infrastructure and operations problems, with the goal of creating scalable and highly reliable
